item.title: Performance Improvements in .NET 10 - .NET Blog
item.description: Take a tour through hundreds of performance improvements in .NET 10.

item.title: TikTok Won. Now Everything Is 60 Seconds.
item.description: As of September 2025, approximately 170 million Americans spend, on average, one hour every day in an app that is designed to maximize psychological grip. While Congress fixates on TikTok‚Äôs data collection usages, what hasn‚Äôt received enough attention is how the platform has successfully industrialized human attention itself.

item.title: C# Lambdas Part 3, Setting Parameters Up Front, and Mismatching Func and Action Definitions | no dogma blog
item.description: Did you know you can define parameters up front in a lambda, and satisfy a Func or Action with a method that doesn't match the definition of the Func/Action?

item.title: OpenAI Platform
item.description: Explore developer resources, tutorials, API docs, and dynamic examples to get the most out of OpenAI's platform.

item.title: The Scam Called ‚ÄúYou Don't Have to Remember Anything‚Äù
item.description: Debunking the myth that search engines and AI eliminate the need for memory. Building deep knowledge through active learning remains essential for critical thinking, despite promises of instant information access.

item.title: I didn't bring my son to a museum to look at screens | Seth Purcell
Multiple Frames In Flight // Vulkan For Beginners #24
item.description:
In this video we learn how to implement multiple frames in flight in Vulkan in order to increase the performance of the message submission mechanism.
üî• See the list of the books that I'm using as background information for my tutorials: https://ogldev.org/books.html I highly recommend them for learning more about OpenGL and Vulkan. These are affiliate links so if you use them to buy any of the books the price is the same for you and I will get a small commission (thank-you!).
üìö Timecodes üìö 0:00 Intro 0:35 Background 1:25 VulkanQueue problem 2:00 Performance analysis tips 2:44 Presentation mode 3:33 Measurement code 4:12 System high level view 5:25 Semaphores 7:18 Frames in flight 7:48 Current implementation problems 8:38 Vulkan fences 9:10 Solution code review 13:04 Out-of-order handling 15:04 Testing out-of-order 15:31 Outro
Make sure to watch all the previous tutorials in the "Vulkan For Beginners" playlist at https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLA0dXqQjCx0RntJy1pqje9uHRF1Z5vZgA
Please visit https://ogldev.org to see more of my tutorials on modern OpenGL.
üî•Link to source: https://github.com/emeiri/ogldev/tree/master/Vulkan/Tutorial24 If you want to get the same version of the code that was used in the video checkout the tag 'VULKAN_24'
üî•Vulkan specification: https://vulkan.lunarg.com/doc/view/1.3.204.1/windows/1.3-extensions/vkspec.html
Feel free to comment below.
üîóContacts: üîπEmail: ogldev1@gmail.com üîπInstagram: @ogldev1 üîπGithub: https://github.com/emeiri/ogldev.git üîπTikTok - https://www.tiktok.com/@ogldev üîπTwitter: @ogldev üîπDiscord: https://discord.gg/CZdVwZgTYk üîπOne time donations (Paypal): https://ogldev.org/donate.html üîπPatreon: https://www.patreon.com/ogldev
üôèCredits: üîπ"Star Citizen" clip by @SuperMacBrother : https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=zyxdoZluxIY üîπVideos by Engin Akyurt and Olena from https://Pixabay.com üîπMusic: ‚ÄúFloating Lanterns‚Äù by The Mini Vandals and ‚ÄúTropic Fuse‚Äù by French Fuse - YouTube Audio Library üîπSound effects by https://Zapsplat.com
Enjoy,
Etay Meiri

item.title: By the way, what are AA?
item.description: Instead of fuzzy labels like 'indie' and 'AA', we propose a new data-driven system to classify video games based on their actual production scope. This new framework reveals the real economic and creative trends shaping the video game industry.

item.title: OrioleDB Patent: now freely available to the Postgres community
item.description: Supabase is explicitly making available a non-exclusive license of the OrioleDB patent to all OrioleDB users in accordance with the OrioleDB license.

item.title: Making Software: What is a color space?
item.description: In which we answer every question you've ever had about digital color, and some you haven't.

item.title: Optimizing Based On Analysis - Game Optimization - Episode 8
item.description:
In this video, we use last week's PIX analysis to optimize our scenes in Unreal and Unity. We're able to improve performance by quite a bit by first finding the right optimization targets.
Here's last week's video about how to use PIX: https://youtu.be/L71zSWE3krk
Take a look at the playlist for the whole series: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PL78XDi0TS4lG4wvgfyGECmB8XiJLCgfFD
Shader Book Recommendations https://www.bencloward.com/resources_books.shtml
------------------------------
Theme Music Peace in the Circuitry - Glitch Hop http://teknoaxe.com/Link_Code_3.php?q=1526
Background Music Speo - The Little Things https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=kvCYuyyLgC0
#UnrealEngine #optimization #Unity

item.description: How I replaced Animal Crossing's dialogue with a live LLM by bridging GameCube memory to a cloud AI, with no game code changes required.
